TopicTitle: Space Center -> (loading) Exit -> (loading) Quit game, yes really.

Articles.Content:
This is a minor issue but there are an annoying amount of windows and buttons to press if I want to quit the game.

The suggestion is to have a quit game button in the space center. Possibly also in the pause menu, but then the pause menu might be too cluttered.

If you're on Windows, Alt-F4 works.

And does it save ? I know some modern games do, but KSP alresy does it ?

And does it save ? I know some modern games do, but KSP alresy does it ?

If you're in the Space Centre there's pretty much nothing else to save.

ah, yes, tat's sensible. I was thinking from an actual flight. I know that I can Alt-f4 from a Dark souls save without ever going back to the menu, and it saves before closing (discovered that by not wanting to use the menu after a bonfire). So I figured it would be the same here.

If you're in the Space Centre there's pretty much nothing else to save.

Technically speaking, the act of packing the current ship into non-physics mode does not have to be accompanied by saving the permanent state on disk (AFAIK the game does not do it when you switch ships in map view) and while you're in Space Center time goes on and your ships keep moving along their orbits. But indeed, the game does save the current state when you enter Space Center.
In my experience, KSP autosaves often enough that you normally don't have to worry about it.

If I want to quickly quit mid-flight, I quicksave then alt-F4.

Ah, the fun times with Alt-F4. Waaaay back when Starcraft was a new game, playing multi-player on Battle.net, I'd see some newb trying to type in cheat codes. I'd tell them they need to press alt-F4 to enable cheats ..... But eventually Blizzard patched it with an "Are you sure you want to quit?" message
I thought I saw an option in the persistence file that was something like "QuitfromXXXXX". You may be able to config this away.
I believe that's possible, yes, but I'm not sure exactly how that one works...

I already spend far too much of my non-existent free time launching kerbals - having to navigate menus steals precious time I could be playing, or worse makes me late for whatever else I was supposed to be doing. Also, it is annoying.

Games that do this right have the two options on the ESC menu: quit to menu, and quit entire. It's no coincidence (ok, it probably is) that the two non-KSP games I've the most time in recently (XCom, Divinity:OS) both have this.
Although it isn't in the menu directly, simply closing the window (if in windowed mode) or using Alt-F4 does this just fine for now.
but still, in other games, in in-game, you both have 'quit to menu' and 'quit to windows' functions. That is what could help KSP in this.

I does take quite a long time to exit the game and that's an issue.

For that matter, it takes a long time to get into a game as well. It would be better if the initial menu was expandable or something instead of going to a separate screen, the transition swipe is annoying at the least.
